title: Excellent resource
text: TEAMS.   Has so much excellent features.   I will continue to work with it.   Only problem is that like most micro software it’s capable of so many things that may be easy to use if you’re a computer programmer but there are very limited resources available for the use and implementation of the system and the time to experiment with the system is not infront of a three hundred person huddle.    There should be a shortcuts and features page. Embedded with this and all products

title: Car Play with iOS Device
text:
I love MA Teams!  The only issue I have right now is that it no longer shows as an optional app for Car Play since the latest iOS device.
I called Apple to tell them several features broke my Car Play since the latest iOS update and the response was that I need to call the company of each application to let them know it’s no longer compatible. Funny thing though, I repeated twice that one app that no longer works on the car display is iTunes playlist.
Either way, I join a lot of conference calls for my job through Teams and now it’s no longer an option for my car display through Car Play.

title: Beyond buggy
text:
There are some things to be fair that the mobile team is doing right like actually showing images instead of links that you get on the Windows app version. But in general this app makes me less productive. I have multiple organizations that I am signed into. With one of them I have voice services setup. Calls do not trigger on here until the last possible second making it impossible for me to pick up. 

The app since probably 5.5 has been losing its authenticated state for the other tenants which I am usually more focused on anyway. I then have to go to Add Account and re-authenticate and wait for it to finish loading so I can get to the tenant I actually need to be in to respond to messages.

title: Where are Notes for Channels on iOS?
text: This would be perfect except on the app, the Notes tab that is available on the PC app is missing from Channels in iOS app. I’ve looked in forums and this has been a problem for at least 2 years with no fix yet. I’ve been working on presenting Microsoft Teams to my university organization as our project planning application, but many of our folks have iPhones and iPads while using desktop PCs for work…if the availability of functions is different between the two, that is unnecessary friction that will hinder adoption. I can’t recommend until this is fixed.

title: Bad Network prompt every 30 seconds
text:
I have fine call quality, video, and can see projected screen content without hitches, but the Bad Network, trying to reconnect message keeps popping up every few seconds during the call with a ding and blacking out the projected screen content. It is incredibly disruptive and annoying. The call is fine and it is the message that is the only thing that’s making it terrible. 
I’d much rather it warned me once and just skipped frames later if needed, rather that complaining about the network all the time. I can definitely tolerate much worse call quality before I would consider disconnecting or dialing in, so the message is not helpful and just disruptive.

title: Always crashing
text:
I like teams, it’s nice and easy-to-use on my iPad, but since mid-September of this year, I’ve had problems of teams randomly (but usually while in a meeting) just lag out and crash. And I have to restart the app and rejoin the meeting, which is a pain sometimes. Then I miss some instructions the teacher said when teams crashed. Overall, teams is nice to use, but has some big performance issues. I’m not even in a meeting and it just crashes. Please try to improve this.

Edit: Teams crashed 5 times in one meeting. 5 TIMES. HI YES, I WOULD LIKE TO ACTUALLY PARTICIPATE INSTEAD OF RELOADING TEAMS EVRY MINUTE THANKS. Oh wait, it will probably never get fixed like any of my problems on teams. Oh well. But please, this is extremely frustrating, and it seems to get worse.

title: Well done, please fix X button
text: I like the app, it’s pretty seamless when I switch from PC to iPad, which is really useful when I have to travel light.  I wish documents could fill the screen...sometimes I have to zoom in and out as I’m reading a document - I don’t need the left pane at those times, I’d like to be able to hide it.  One more thing that would be great - can you make the X button work when you’re viewing a file?  I keep having to use the left pane to go all the way home, tapping X doesn’t do anything.  Thanks for putting this together; I appreciate that there is an iPad version.

title: Very Convenient for Quick Communication
text: The Teams app is truly amazing for staying in touch with my team. If I need to reach out to my scheduling team, higher management, or my coworkers for work-related questions, all I have to do is send a quick chat using the Teams app, and they respond promptly. Even when I'm on the go, I can simply grab my phone and send a quick message through the Teams app, eliminating the need to log in to my work email. Everything I need is at my fingertips.

title: Multifunctional, wonderful app for business and personal use
text: I have used Teams to coordinate school projects and now in my professional career. It’s very easy for communicating with other team members with the formality of email. I am a big fan! I take advantage of the gifs feature and use it to lighten up all my conversations—something you can’t do over email. It’s also easy to share files and create specialized teams within the to platform to help you stay organized. Love it!

title: Great functionality
text: My favorite app for remote meetings, as it handles creating unique teams with shared files, group and private chats, video call and also regular voice calls. I can call colleagues in Guam without long distance fees! One thing that could be improved though is file structure. Things become cumbersome if you’re on 20+ teams. Could use a better way of visualizing teams, files, chats, etc. so it’s easier to find each team and it’s subcategories (files, pages, references, chats). Otherwise, functionality and intuitiveness are excellent!

title: Mobile Work Improvement
text: This App is really important to being able to communicate with team members while being on the plant floor or other places without my laptop. The biggest issue the app has is that sometimes it can be a little finicky when trying to join a teams call, but usually closing the call and rejoining fixes the issue. I think that if you have the Teams computer application for business that the mobile app is a critical extension to the program that every team member should download ASAP!

title: The best.
text:
The whole platform - Teams is excellent, you can do everything in one app and it really adds features every time! This is so good.

One thing to those folks, who don’t like this mixed assignments app, for me it’s so good because I can see all assignments which I have to do personally, so I don’t have to check all classes for assignments. One tip for those who want assignments divided - go to your class’ team, then you will see three menus - Posts, Files and More/ Three dot menu, after tapping on More/Tree dot menu, choose assignments, there you go.

title: Strong app - STILL needs some additional features.
text:
UPDATED 10/13: STILL SHOCKED that these updates have not yet come to the app. Reducing rating for now. 

 Microsoft has created a truly outstanding tool that has proved itself invaluable with regards to remote working from an iPad/iPhone. 

A few items that need to be addressed: 

URGENT! 1) To match the functionality of Zoom on iPad OS, the camera should remain on when in slide over/split screen mode. This is ESSENTIAL. 
 2) On iPad, allow users to open chat/participant list in a sidebar while still viewing the participants in the call. The fact that the entirety of the screen is taken up by chat and participant list is a major frustration when monitoring groups and/or chat. 
 3) In-call support keyboard shortcuts for muting/unmuting, opening chat, participant list (at a minimum). 
 4) Ability to manage breakout rooms via iPad OS. 
5) The ability to edit meeting notes (Wiki) from the iOS app. Thanks for all the fantastic work on the app!

title: Pretty good , still confused
text: So I use the app for school it’s a pretty good app and it’s very helpful since we are all in a pandemic and I can’t go to in-person school .this is what we have been using for are meetings .over all this is a pretty great app but a lot of people in my class get updates on there app and some don’t . A lot of them tried to download the app again a few times and they still didn’t get the update they checked there settings and everything like that and just a lot of people didn’t ever get updates even when the looked at settings and re downloaded it

title: Needs Pencil and whiteboard support for iPad
text: I like the concept and happy that Microsoft is making a proactive approach to truly integrate their product portfolio. Really excited to try this with my team and create better work flows. One thing I that is missing is that there is a screen sharing option on the desktop option, while this option might not be available, a white board option which can be used during group calls can go along way in communication and alignment. Please off some type of Apple Pencil support.

title: Way better than Skype
text: This is a great app to use for all communications in the office.  Our owner is out of state so it allows him to be more connected to what’s happening in our office. We use the instant messaging a lot to get quick answers that doesn’t require a phone call that interrupts work completely. Love the video chat feature and the capability to take control of one another’s computers.  Really helps when viewing reports or working on projects together when not in the same office.  Been using the product for over a month now and so far it has met all of our needs.

title: Teams Review
text: Honestly it’s a really great application to have at work since the user interface is very easy to navigate and understandable. The mobile feature makes having work on the phone a breeze and when you want to disconnect from work it’s just as easy! Far better to use then the next leading app and the ability for connecting devices to Teams is unbeatable. Thoroughly enjoy utilizing this vital tool at work daily, 10/10 for quality!

title: Call logs??
text: The app works well. I’m glad to communicate with my coworkers on mobile, it provides a lot of flexibility. However, every single teams call that happens shows up in my iPhone recent calls??? They aren’t phone calls. I don’t want them there. I use my phone for doctors appointments and casual chats with my friends. I don’t want a million teams calls showing up in my recent calls list. There needs to be a setting for this. It’s insanely inconvenient. I’ve missed calls from my doctor because the teams calls flood my history. I don’t really want to get a separate work phone just to use teams. Please make a setting to have this disabled.

title: Ruined my quarantine (Read & You will understand)
text:
I’m Just a Teenager Who is Just trying to enjoy there break , But No! title: No Swipe Navigation
text: I’m coming from slack and not being able to use multiple accounts is limiting. Worst off, I cannot navigate with swipes. In a world dominated by smartphones, being able to swipe to navigate is required. With slack you can easily navigate around with a swipe. Reading new chats is difficult as the color scheme is terrible, plus there is hardly any space between threads so it all starts blending together. On a longer thread you have to spend so much time searching. When it comes to text input, you don’t have the ability to expand the chat input box full screen makes it really nice. I’m only using teams because my company is testing with it as it comes with office.

title: Great co-working, integrations and team workspaces
text:
The layout, functionality and great cross-collaboration features are better than on previous versions. Integration with office365 and outlook/calendar is brilliant. File sharing, editing, collaboration, groups management and in build analytics features are more than welcome 🤗 
Ability to switch between different devices works smoothly and perfect. Battery drain is on normal level (iPhone X can last all day on mix video/audio activities)
Thanks

title: It’s getting better for the classroom
text:
I’ve been using teams as a teacher for over a year and the improvements are showing. At first it was so hard to use that it wasn’t worth it for the average teacher. As the interface has gotten more user friendly more and more of my colleagues are using teams in the classroom. 
I’d love to be able to search assignments instead of just filtering by tags. Opening PDFs in adobe instead of downloading or in a browser would be nice too.

title: Badge notifications show up even when viewed already
text: I think my only issue with this app is that it shows me there are notifications with red badges even when there are none. For example right now it shows “4” on the red badge even though I’ve opened them all on the app. Further, there appears to be no connection between the iOS app and the PC version for notifications. If I view items on the PC the badge icon on the iOS app should be cleared. And for sure it should be cleared after I open the iOS app. But it does not clear the badge icon.

title: Full of features
text:
We recently switched to 365. And I have really been loving teams and its functionality. As Microsoft continues to make this the primary commutative platform, it just keeps getting better and better. 

It has been 13 years since I have used Microsoft products. They were really behind the times in comparison to send their major and minor competitors. They have really stepped up their game and have made some really incredible products again.

title: One of the worst remote access clients
text:
Quite often I am forced to use Teams because the company on the other side uses it. For me it almost never connects. At times I have to reboot just to make it load. Then it never remembers my settings. For instance every time I load it I have to go and change the background to blur. Every f’ing time. But the worst thing - it keeps saying “log in to have more options” but when I try to log in it just hangs up on some animated GIF. Absolutely the worst. It also makes the whole experience quite annoying when you have a meeting coming up and a dumb software doesn’t load. If I could use Zoom over this I would do it in a heartbeat. 

PS. Enterprises, STOP using it!!!!

title: Works seamlessly
text: The app is extremely user friendly even for the first time user. Sharing documents and recordings is also super intuitive and the interface itself works very nicely with other third-party add-ins. Even though I’m on a corporate account which comes with extra bang, word on the street is that they have no time limits either which is convenient and definitely cost effective compared to competition. They definitely deserve a solid 5 star !

title: Switched from Skype for Business
text: My Company switched from Skype for Business to Teams late last month (April 2021) and I love it so much. Skype was always very buggy. Our customers hated using it. We hated using it. We haven’t even started using the “Teams” tab yet. Just for chatting, conference calls, and screen share alone it is so much better than Skype for Business. The mobile app works with my work PC seamlessly. I can’t wait to keep unlocking more potential out of this app.

title: Team - where to meet with your team… missing on screen annotation…
text: As a Zoom, Webex, GotoMeeting, BlueJeans user, the graduation to a “mature repackaged Skype with extras” has been welcome. Feature for feature very similar offering as the others. Bonus for the Microsoft -centric world is the integration with Outlook excellent use of shared contacts, and other more esoteric integration with newer Microsoft apps. Very real shortcoming is the lack of an ability to “mark-up or annotate on screen” - something that Zoom does very well.

title: I wish this didn’t exist.
text:
Absolutely terrible app.
Clicking on a new notification only brings you to an outdated link to older versions of posts.
New notifications aren’t marked read after you click on them.
Even after sliding “marked as read” they STILL don’t go away.
The interface is clunky and disorganized, so is tagging users to posts.
Team calls have an excruciating delay, and often cut out, so users are constantly interrupting each other, and repeating themselves.
To make things worse, tasks cannot be created in Teams, so an entirely separate app like Planner has to be used for that, even though both applications are owned by Microsoft.
I’m forced to use this atrocity of a software application only because my boss insists it works well. So if you like it, and you agree with him, well then bully for you.
But if you’re as fed up as I am, then maybe you also hope enough one star reviews will compel somebody to do something about it.
And maybe one day, we won’t have to settle for relying on the laziest of mediocrities just to get our work done.

title: Great app - but bloated. Please optimize M$!
text: Great app, but bloated. Drains battery at an alarming rate especially while in a conference call. A 1hr video conference drains 34% of iPhone 14 pro max battery, nearly twice that of the other video conferencing apps on the market. If the devs can finds a way to lighten it up and optimize it so it’s not so laggy, bloated and power hungry, then it will be the best of many competing applications in a single solution. (The other popular video conferencing app uses 18% per hour, not going to say the name, but it definitely “zooms” along faster and more efficiently for sure)

title: Works but could be better
text:
Works as intended but two things need to be improved. 

1. The consistency between statuses from my desktop to my phone never match. If my phone is one and active than I’m clearly available. If it shows me active on the app half the time it shows me away on my PC. These need better syncing. 
2. Spell/auto-correct. Why is the auto-correct 1000 times worse than the chat apps on my phone? Constantly changes correctly spelled prepositions into other prepositions, and even if it’s just one letter off out of a 6+ letter word and it won’t correct.

title: Notifications
text: Great app and very user friendly. Would have been a 5 star rating although when you open the app and you miss a bunch of messages it will notify you at the top of the app one by one. This can get frustrating if you were in a direct message and you are trying to get back to all your chats as the button to go back constantly gets hidden from the notifications. If this can be adjusted it would truly make navigating more effective and user friendly appropriate for 5 stars!

title: Smartsheet the in-betweener
text: Like this platform because it is an option between phone call and email. It gives a more conversational feel and are less prone to misinterpretation. Phone calls don’t provide the “evidence” that communication occurred, or an easy way to follow up on things discussed on a call.  If something is discussed in a call, I feel the need to recap in an email so the participants (myself included) can correct something that may have been Mis-stated. In teams I don’t have to do the “double duty” of recapping in email.

title: Great app for collaboration
text:
We have been using Skype in our business environment and it was working ok until the lockdown. When everybody is working from home, Skype started having many issues and that is when we switched to Teams. It has been a great collaboration tool. 
The sharing of content and being able to chat with one person to groups of people has worked flawlessly. Being able to go back to topics and see the relevant conversations to that topic has been tremendously useful too.

title: 2 monitors Capability
text: Hi first of all I would like to thank you for this great app it is amazing and helps a lot and presenting and meeting with my team daily thing I would request to enhance since I work with three monitors minimum with two is to have that capability is on one monitor will have the video feed of the participant and the second monitor I can see the presentation as a handle many teams that option will be very viableAnd will accomplish two points one is to see everyones attentiveness and the other to monitor the presentation thank you very much and hope this can be added as a feature

title: Teams Review
text: I generally finding this app extremely useful, especially in our current remote work environment. Our in-office fast message system doesn’t work well with VPN so having the Chat feature is great. I will say that the Teams video conferencing is not yet as good as the others I am most familiar with, Skype for Business and Zoom. I hope that Microsoft will continue to improve it, especially as it is my understanding that they intend to remove Skype for Business from Office 365.

title: Decent.
text:
Pretty good... Wish: 

 Computer app has ability to set up breakout rooms—but not on iPhone/iPad app. Please add!! Thanks. Ability to PLEASE forcibly mute someone and make that person STAY MUTED for GCC. Think of the teachers PLEASE. This already exists on the computer app—you just need it for iPad and iPhone. ALSO ability to send invite for someone to unmute themselves, much like in Zoom. You can request someone unmute themself and it sends them an invite. Great for less tech savvy people.

Lastly, 2-way simultaneous interpreting audio channels PLEASE! (This is for language translation)

title: Connect everything together
text:
Teams allows you to house everything in a single location, from documents, apps, to meetings and chat conversations if you use it correctly you can increase transparency and accountability without losing effectiveness or efficiency.

My biggest complaint is differentiating Teams and Chat since the “Teams Team” sounds so awful people may believe you’re confused or repeating a word. I’m not but I’m not interested in sounding poorly informed.

title: Teams in IOS is a million time better than the Windows counterpart
text: Microsoft Teams client on iOS is very easy to use and much more performant when compared to the one running on Windows 11 as of today. I suspect the web runtime that the desktop client uses is sub optimal when compared to native client even when the native client running on mobile devices. I would certainly use this iOS version any day compared to the one running on desktop today.

title: Not quite Slack, but cheaper
text: Microsoft has done a pretty good job at closing the gaps with Slack, so Teams are quite usable now, and it is cheaper if you have the Office (business) 365 type license already.  The limit of how many channels will show is inconvenient for bigger teams.  Threading is not quite up to what Slack does (there is a Threads view there that shows things you have interacted with that have further updates).  Slack bots integration also better.  I’d say Teams has come close to catching Slack in other areas, pretty much a toss up with Discord.

title: Unable to sign in (updated)
text:
Just bought a new iPhone 8 and although I can sign into any other Microsoft app I can't seem to sign into teams. Just gives me a black screen and boots to the home menu. Please fix as our company uses this app to keep in contact and we're always working remotely.

Updated (9/25) this morning and the app is working fine now. Haven’t run into any issues. Great app and service and much better than Skype for business. Changing score from 2 to 5 stars.

title: App hangs and the crashes after tapping a response icon
text: Go to a message in a Team, then tap on a response icon like a smiley face, thumbs-ip, etc.. App hangs, and sometimes crashes. If it doesn’t crash the user must kill the app. On the next startup of the app the response icon has been accepted. This has been happening on my iPhone 11 running the latest version of iOS through several updates of Teams. Posting here because there doesn’t seem to any way to provide feedback to Microsoft except using a Windows app!

title: This app is amazing! One suggestion
text:
Hello there, I am student that is currently using Teams for my internship meetings. This app is wonderfully awesome and very useful! You can connect with other people very easily and the audio is absolutely perfect.
There is something I would like to talk about though: When I share my screen with other people in the meeting, my camera automatically turns off and people can only see the two initials of my name. Can you please find a way in which when the presenter shares their screen, their camera is still on and other people can still see their face?
Other than that, everything is totally amazing and I totally recommend this app to everyone. This wonderful app quickly connects the community together, especially during this difficult time.
Thank you so much for creating Microsoft Teams and providing new updates!

Sincerely,
Vy

title: Kills the battery, iPad gets WAY too hot
text:
I use Teams regularly for work on my laptop / desktop and have recently started using it on an iPad Pro 11” M1 chip. 

When running on the iPad, it kills the battery very fast (-15% battery at the end of a 30 min video call) and it cooks the iPad (120 deg F exterior temp within 15 mins of video call). The iPad becomes too hot to handle comfortably and the screen goes through a series of dimming / power down stages just to it keep running.

I know that Teams is a resource hog from my time on a Windows desktop but there needs to be some serious optimizations and improvements before this app becomes a viable, regular work-day tool.

title: General good but needs the Microsoft scales removed
text:
Generally a great app, but it’s lots of little things that spoil the user experience.

Add contact does not make the text field active, so you have to reach for the mouse again.  Annoying.

Edit is right next to delete.  I use edit a lot.

Delete is an immediate action. 

Buttons are small. 

Text is small and no way to increase size by a point or two.

Speech bubbles are a waste of space.

The feeling I have when using most MS products is frustration.  It’s a shame.  

It all adds up to typical MS design.  They need to spend more time on UX.   It takes time to get right, but MS product typically have a lot of low hanging fruit in this area, that if they tackled, it would make a world of difference.

I came from Slack, and when I first started using teams, it struck me how unintuitive the UI was.  Common, important features hidden away.  Felt like Windows 8 all over again.   Same designer perhaps?

title: Too many limitations
text: The appeal of Teams, Slack, or any other similar service is the integration with other applications. On my iPad Pro, I would expect to have access to most of these integrations. Unfortunately, the iPad app is treated as the same as an iPhone in terms of assumed capability. My iPad Pro is far faster and more powerful than my work provided 2012 MacBook Pro, yet Microsoft has hamstrung its app where I am unable to edit posts where I’ve shared content, nor am I able to contribute to meeting notes. Overall, I appreciate the chat and conversation features for my iPhone, but I’m highly disappointed in Microsoft’s lack of imagination for the iPad Pro.

title: And—- This app is still a Major Fail!!!
text:
Update: Once again, your update fails. If you’re going to market to schools, your app should provide the opportunity to submit work. 

I’m a teacher, and my school district recently began using TEAMS to increase student/ teacher connectivity, improve access to documents and information, and provide an avenue for a more digital classroom. While the desktop version is wonderful, the app is HORRIBLE. Many students rely on their phones for access, and the app version fails to provide the required assignment tab for full functionality. It’s my hope that the developers will see fit to remedy this in the next update. Until then, the app is a serious failure for my students, my classroom, and my district.

title: Very useful tool for teams not in the same location
text: Our team is spread across 4 states & it’s very helpful & easy to ask a quick question of the other locations without clogging up emails that could easily get lost. We can share files, work on them together, message each other, & call/video chat all within one app. It’s great that it can be downloaded and used on a phone, tablet, or computer. I highly recommend teams!

title: Requires access to local network
text:
I use the app to connect to a meeting and was prompted to grant Teams access to my local network. When I refused that access the call hung and I had to click the back icon. It looks like Teams cannot connect unless I grant it access to my local network even though the call works fine on other systems that only have Internet access.

I don't know what Microsoft is trying to do, whether this is a data collection or some ham-fisted attempt at security, but this is inexcusable and I will not allow this app on my device or to access my local network. I don't have any similar problem with Zoom, Google Meet, or other voice over IP apps that I use.
